name: Harbour Grand Kowloon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in an Harbour from Club room on the 19th floor for 5 great nights. Easy & friendly check in. Very good service all the time in club lounge area and from all the staff in general.
reviews.title: Harbour view club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: View over the harbour was outstanding , watching a cruise ship sail past one day and a floating restaruant at night. Something happening on the water all the time.
reviews.title: Good, but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast, afternoon teas & snacks in the club lounge were fresh and ample. Good selection of wine & beer for evening drinks. Top floor pool & whrilpool & a well equiped gym. Good fun on a treadmill watching the goings on in the harbour. Steam room & sauna & good showers in gym area.
reviews.title: Inconvenient location

reviews.text: Large room with very firm bed, huge bathroom with a powerfull shower.
reviews.title: Great pool view of Hong Kong Island

reviews.text: Shuttle bus into main part of town but some large shopping areas near hotel where the locals shop. Enjoyed a meal in the Japanese restaruant.
reviews.title: Nice if you like to stay in kowloon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had three nights at the Harbour Grand and would struggle to find anything but positive comments to offer.
reviews.title: Perfect city hotel

reviews.text: We had booked a room on the Club floor. Definitely worth it if you can stretch the budget. Amazing views over the harbour, private check in, afternoon tea, evening pre dinner drinks and free wi fi in the lounge area.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, highly recommend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was spacious, comfortable, immaculate and extremely quiet.
reviews.title: Lovely modern hotel with fantastic views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel were friendly, efficient and really helpful. They had a huge amount of information and were genuinly interested in your day.
reviews.title: Another great stay at the Harbour Grand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts were served in the club lounge and were excellent.
reviews.title: Staff wonderful ,very happy, helpful,great hotel.

reviews.text: Whilst some may say this hotel is out of the way it does offer tranquility and a chance to escape the crowds. And lets face it - where in HK is too far away when cabs are so cheap. The hotel is close to Hong Hum - perfect the trip into Shenzen and a very short walk to the Hong Hum/North Point ferry. And there is some good shopping and restaurants in Whampoa.
reviews.title: Tranquility can be accredited to location and staff

reviews.text: Whilst we stayed on the Club Level (very good value) the service was excellent and the staff were very friendly and professional. The front desk were excellent in helping on any issue - large or small.
reviews.title: Fabulous but a bit out of the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were relatively large and comfortable - my only complaint being the range and quality of toiletries was very poor. The pool on the whirlpool were also very good on the roof.
reviews.title: Far from the madding crowds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet lunch downstairs was excellent - great range, quality and good price.
reviews.title: Away from the Noise

reviews.text: Considering that Nathan Road is only a HK$20 approx ride away I find this oasis a great place to stay in HK.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Harbour Grand Hotel for 4 nights during August. The rooms are particularly large for Hong Kong standards and the view of the harbour from the room was really amazing. We staying in the club room in order to benefit from the club lounge access as well as the free facilities and club breakfast.
reviews.title: Not As Grand As We Thought

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa facilities were a bit tierd and the sauna and steam room were very small, but it was still nice to be able to access them for free after a busy day in the city. The one thing that was a bit annoying was that you could only eat your breakfast in the club lounge and the breakfast selection was not very good. If you wanted to go to the downstairs breakfast you had to pay an additional fee. I thought it was quite strange that when you pay the additional for a club room, you get a worse breakfast then then you would have received if you had paid for a standard room at the hotel. I defnitely think that they need to look at improving the breakfast in the club lounge, because at the moment the extra club room charge is defnitely not worth your while.
reviews.title: Very good but would probably not stay again
Love this hotel so much!
reviews.text: The hotel is also not in close walking distance to the MTR station, however the hotel does offer a free shuttle service into the city which is defnitely worth while and available every 30mins. This is available to all hotel guests.

The hotel also has a buffet meal at their main restuarant every night. Although the price per person is expensive, it is defnitely worth while. The spread and selection of food and drink available is really fantastic. Was one of our best meals in Hong Kong.
reviews.title: Not too bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were also very friendly. In particular, the staff in the club lounge made an effort to get to know you and were always helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Room With A View

description: The rebranded Harbour Grand Kowloon was formerly named Harbour Plaza Hong Kong. It is a deluxe five-star hotel with 554 beautifully appointed rooms and serviced suites located along the Kowloon waterfront offering breathtaking views of Victoria Harbour.Conveniently situated next to the Wonderful Worlds of Whampoa, the hotel is adjacent to the ferry pier travelling to North Point and is only five minutes away by complimentary hotel shuttle bus to MTR Hunghom Station and downtown Tsimshatsui’s business and shopping district. Key facilities include wireless broadband Internet service - available throughout the hotel, a deluxe fitness centre with sauna, steam bath and Spa Services, a rooftop pool featuring a one-sided glass wall overlooking the harbour, six renowned restaurants, a 4,500 sq ft. Grand Ballroom and three versatile function rooms for meetings and conferences.
